text: President Obama and Pope Francis
together for the first time the meeting
between the Pope and the president
seemed to have a very light-hearted mood
Doug Mills The Times White House
photographer on the president's papal
visit inside the Vatican the president
and Pope stood side-by-side meeting
dignitaries and despite divisions
between Catholics and the Obama
administration's position on issues like
abortion the two men sought common
ground in a shared ambition to change
the economic fortunes of working-class
people in the poor during the exchange
of gifts both of them joked a number of
times the president presented the Pope
with a custom-made seed chest featuring
a variety of fruit vegetable seeds used
in the White House garden the box is
made up of timber from the first
Cathedral to open the United States in
Baltimore the Pope gave the president a
book and the president said that he
would read this during his time in the
Oval Office when things get tough
